text:
Hey everyone! 
We're new to HubSpot and we’d love some help in trying to figure out what the best way would be to integrate our license generation system to our knowledgebase. 
We want to integrate through REST API to a 3rd party service.
So the current program we're using uses cookies and cURL commands to log into the server then based on info submitted by the user it finds the CustomerId in the db.
We use read commands to enter different properties inserted by the user (on HubSpot it’ll be Form properties) and with them we change an updating XML file.
We create a fingerprint V2C file (a file which contains protected information about the license terms and data stored in deployed Sentinel protection keys).
Should we go to OAuth or webhooks? Can webhooks be used to login to the 3rd party service and read POST request responses? I figure that a form can’t be updated live after a webhook is triggered so is an App required for this?

good morning community, is there a way to save more than one value in a form field?
I am using the HubSpot api to send and yet in a field I need to save more than one option or at least save the user more than once but with a different field.
Are you talking about a multi select field? Saving a user multiple times is a no go, saving multiple values as well.
What you can do, is use a textfield, and a csv style input
Can I use HubDb multiselector field for HubDbAPI?

Hey guys!
I'm trying to get the API key but this message's shown even I'm already a super admin!
Could you please help me figure out what's going on?

hi <@U02412A8Q3V>
Is it possible that only the "safe" field is updated with each submission of the form by api?

so you can save another option in addition to the one you already have

I remember this I had the same issue, the  property for the percent discount is `hs_discount_percentage`. I would suggest using the API v2 docs while looking for properties since the newer docs are still lacking those informations <https://api.hubapi.com/properties/v2/quotes/properties?hapikey=demo>

Hey peeps, I'm trying to pull in additional fields for the Deals API but they're not coming through. I'm trying to pull in the following fields: hs_analytics_source, hs_analytics_source_data_1, hs_analytics_source_data_2
